# set up some functions clear_temp () { rm -f "$SP_QUERY_RESULT_FILE" rm -f "$SP_QUERY_FILE" rm -f "$SP_QUERY_RESULT_STATUS_FILE" }
execute_sql() { # execute the SQL statement; the result will be available in the file $SP_QUERY_RESULT_FILE open "sequelpro://$SP_PROCESS_ID@passToDoc/ExecuteQuery"
# wait for Sequel Pro; status file will be written to disk if query was finished while [ 1 ] do [[ -e "$SP_QUERY_RESULT_STATUS_FILE" ]] && break sleep 0.01 done
# check for errors if [ `cat $SP_QUERY_RESULT_STATUS_FILE` == 1 ]; then echo "Query error." exit $SP_BUNDLE_EXIT_SHOW_AS_HTML_TOOLTIP fi }
# start clean clear_temp
# Check if one table is selected if [ -z "$SP_SELECTED_TABLES" ]; then echo "<font color=red>Please select a table.</font>" exit $SP_BUNDLE_EXIT_SHOW_AS_HTML_TOOLTIP fi
# Split by tab IFS=$'\t' read -r -a tables <<< "$SP_SELECTED_TABLES"
# Loop through tables for table in "${tables[@]}" do
# get the table structure, including field comments echo " SELECT COLUMN_NAME AS 'Field', COLUMN_TYPE AS 'Type', IS_NULLABLE AS 'Null', COLUMN_KEY AS 'Key', COLUMN_DEFAULT AS 'Default', EXTRA AS 'Extra', COLUMN_COMMENT AS 'Comments' FROM information_schema.columns WHERE TABLE_NAME = '${table}';" > "$SP_QUERY_FILE"
# execute and save the table structure result execute_sql cp $SP_QUERY_RESULT_FILE "$SP_BUNDLE_PATH/rowsStructure.tsv"
clear_temp
# send SHOW INDEXES query to Sequel Pro echo "SHOW INDEXES FROM ${table}" > "$SP_QUERY_FILE"
# execute and save the SHOW INDEXES result execute_sql cp $SP_QUERY_RESULT_FILE "$SP_BUNDLE_PATH/rowsKeys.tsv"
clear_temp
# check if CONSTRAINTS exists cat <<SQL > "$SP_QUERY_FILE" SELECT count(kcu.CONSTRAINT_NAME) FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.REFERENTIAL_CONSTRAINTS rc LEFT JOIN INFORMATION_SCHEMA.KEY_COLUMN_USAGE kcu ON (rc.CONSTRAINT_NAME=kcu.CONSTRAINT_NAME) WHERE rc.TABLE_NAME = '${table}'; SQL
# check for errors execute_sql
if [ `cat $SP_QUERY_RESULT_STATUS_FILE` > 0 ]; then clear_temp
# send CONSTRAINTS query to Sequel Pro cat <<SQL > "$SP_QUERY_FILE" SELECT kcu.CONSTRAINT_NAME, kcu.COLUMN_NAME, kcu.REFERENCED_TABLE_NAME, kcu.REFERENCED_COLUMN_NAME, rc.UPDATE_RULE, rc.DELETE_RULE FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.REFERENTIAL_CONSTRAINTS rc LEFT JOIN INFORMATION_SCHEMA.KEY_COLUMN_USAGE kcu ON (rc.CONSTRAINT_NAME=kcu.CONSTRAINT_NAME) WHERE rc.TABLE_NAME = '${table}'; SQL
# save the CONSTRAINTS result execute_sql cp $SP_QUERY_RESULT_FILE "$SP_BUNDLE_PATH/rowsConstraints.tsv" else echo -n "" > "$SP_BUNDLE_PATH/rowsConstraints.tsv" fi
# process the results and save to the desktop FILENAME=$(date "+%Y_%m_%d_%H%M%S_create_${table}_table.php") /usr/bin/php "$SP_BUNDLE_PATH/parse.php" "${table}" > ~/Desktop/$FILENAME echo "Migration saved to ~/Desktop/$DATAFILENAME."
# clean up clear_temp
# end loop through tables done
Exports the selected table to a Laravel migration file on the desktop.
Export the selected table to Laravel migration file on the Desktop
